extendedInfo.description: Ghost SEED - the global game of local influenceGhost SEED is a free-to-play, massively-multiplayer, location-based game. Sign up as an operative for one of three Practical Particle Physics research organizations and start claiming territory for your side!When we say local, we mean very, very local.Spitting distance local. Everything you do in the game is done within a ~25 meter radius of your actual position on Earth. Since the game is played with dynamic, interacting pieces called SEEDs (Selective Entropy Emitting Dualities), other players are invisible in the game. Their ghostly influence can only be felt through the effects of their SEEDs.It's a game of territorial conquest played on a global map.Every operative belongs to one of three organizations competing for global dominance. You will place SEEDs to claim territory, attack enemies and defend allies. This is not just a numbers game - attacks happen through line-of-sight so placement matters.Strategize with your teammates. Undermine your enemies.Each organization has a unique motivation, but all are hell bent on expanding their influence at the expense of the others. Forums and in-game messaging allow you to strategize and coordinate tactical maneuvers with teammates. A dynamic, single-server, persistent world means your victories (and defeats) will change the balance of power on the map.There's a hidden world all around you. Wanna see?

reviews.title: Join the N.O.D.E
reviews.comment: Come let us conquer this earth.Those of you with power, Fear us! Those of you without it, Rally behind us! We knights of N.O.D.E., shall be the ones who stand in judgement of this world! Join with node and forever be in control of your Destiny!
reviews.author: Watanuki Kimihiro

reviews.title: Pretty cool
reviews.comment: An interesting game. I like it. Needa more active players around here. Lol
reviews.author: Zanko Black

reviews.title: Eh...
reviews.comment: Did you play Ingress? Did you like it? Good... This is not Ingress. It\'s close, in some aspects, but lacks the ability to hold my attention. And (if it weren\'t for the fact that the numbers changed on a daily basis in two cells several miles north of me) I was dead sure I was the only person playing this game. Not my bag.
reviews.author: Jason Pace

reviews.title: Good concept, poor delivery
reviews.comment: This has a lot of potential, put until the developers figure out how to actually explain how the game works, it\'s useless. It\'s like taking a bunch of children from a third world country, giving them a chess set and expect them to be able to play chess with eachother without ever explaining what each piece can and can\'t do.

reviews.title: Pay2Win App
reviews.comment: This app sells credits which give an in-game advantage for RL money.  This makes it a pay2win app, which wasn\'t mentioned in the description anywhere and you don\'t discovered until you have begin playing the game.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes ALL THE TIME
reviews.comment: 1) Because I drop signal, it crashes many times daily.  I still love it, but the crashing seriously needs to stop.  When I push \"send report\", it crashes Google Play (which wasn\'t running), so I dunno what\'s going on there.    2) Can\'t click sometimes.    a: when crashing, I can\'t click Force-close unless I turn the screen off/on, then the button is enabled.  b: when playing, the screen becomes unclickable, unless I refresh it by going into the Marketplace (or similar) and backing out again.    3) Boy is it frustrating that it can\'t play a FORT at my most recent location.  I\'ll be there, drop one, and move on (bus-riding) too far away by the time it\'s verified.    4) Do we really need to drain all my battery in 2 hours?  Wow, guys.  Maybe a setting to check how often the GPS is called?  HOWEVER, I love it, so it gets 4 stars. :D
reviews.author: A Google User
